book.title: Clean Code
book.synopsis: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees.
book.author: Robert C. Martin

book.title: Java: The Complete Reference
book.synopsis: The definitive guide to Java programming thoroughly explains every aspect of the language.
book.author: Herbert Schildt

book.title: Python Crash Course
book.synopsis: A fast-paced, no-nonsense guide to programming in Python.
book.author: Eric Matthes

book.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
book.synopsis: Your journey to mastery as a programmer and software developer.
book.author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas

book.title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
book.synopsis: A catalog of simple and succinct solutions to common design problems.
book.author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides

book.title: You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
book.synopsis: No matter how much experience you have with JavaScript, odds are you don’t fully understand the language.
book.author: Kyle Simpson

book.title: Effective Java
book.synopsis: A definitive guide to writing robust, maintainable, and efficient Java code.
book.author: Joshua Bloch

book.title: Introduction to Algorithms
book.synopsis: An essential guide to understanding algorithms and data structures.
book.author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein

book.title: Cracking the Coding Interview
book.synopsis: A comprehensive guide to technical interview preparation.
book.author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell

book.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
book.synopsis: A comprehensive introduction to the theory and practice of artificial intelligence.
book.author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig

book.title: Grokking Algorithms
book.synopsis: An illustrated guide to understanding algorithms.
book.author: Aditya Bhargava

book.title: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
book.synopsis: A fascinating exploration of the development of computer technology.
book.author: Charles Petzold

book.title: Mathematics for Computer Science
book.synopsis: An essential resource for understanding the mathematics that underpin computer science.
book.author: Eric Lehman, F. Thomson Leighton, Albert R. Meyer

book.title: Deep Learning
book.synopsis: An in-depth guide to deep learning from some of the field's leading experts.
book.author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville

book.title: Algorithms to Live By: The Computer Science of Human Decisions
book.synopsis: Exploring how algorithms can be applied to everyday life.
book.author: Brian Christian, Tom Griffiths
